job.title: Chief Cybersecurity Research Scientist
job.description:
Does a career focused on changing the world's energy future intrigue you? If so, we might have just the opportunity you're looking for!

Idaho National Laboratory (INL) seeks a Chief Cybersecurity Research Scientist for the National & Homeland Security (N&HS) directorate. The primary role of the Chief Cybersecurity Scientist is to advance the scientific and engineering eminence and vitality of the INL, with specific emphasis on the N&HS missions and Lab-wide infrastructure security initiatives.

This position works closely with leadership in cyber mission line organizations including the Cybercore Integration Center, which leads INL's effort to expand government, industry, and university partnerships for cybersecurity with its growing Research & Education Campus. Optional Joint Appointment(s) for research or teaching are available with INL's many national and regional university partners.

Responsibilities Include
  • Build and lead collaborative research teams to advance strategic national/international initiatives.
  • Development, chairing, and mentoring for leadership of national/international level conferences, symposia, and workshops on cutting-edge science and engineering to address national challenges.
  • Advancing scientific basis and technical outcomes for cyber-physical systems programs through personal and team publications, patents, presentations, and membership on national/international-level professional organizations, advisory panels, editorial boards, and standards committees.
  • Mentoring of junior staff, postdocs, and interns in the development of high quality research proposals, peer reviewed publications, presentations, and technologies.
  • Support the development of strategic vision that aligns research investments to national challenges that are relevant to N&HS customer needs and condensed into actionable programmatic R&D within the sponsor's perceived funding windows.
  • Advise and grow new research areas that complement cybersecurity missions, including wireless security, Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning and the adversarial challenges with them.
  • Member of the directorate committee for the advancement of science and engineering within N&HS, which includes all N&HS fellows.
  • Lab Directed R&D (LDRD) leadership and committee work as assigned.
As the principal initial program leadership responsibility, this position will also provide thought leadership to the Cybersecurity Manufacturing Innovation Institute (CyManII) consortium. CyManII is developing a new Secure Manufacturing Architecture (SMA) and national innovation ecosystem to secure both automation and supply chain to achieve a digital transformation and energy efficiency in U.S manufacturing. CyManII is a national research consortium funded by DOE and led by University of Texas San Antonio (UTSA), with INL as a managing partner, and about 60 leading university and industry partners that collaborate on the creation and execution of a national R&D roadmap to solve the fundamental challenges in cybersecurity for U.S. manufacturing.

Minimum Requirements
  • Applicants must have a Ph.D. in Computer Science or closely related field plus 10 years work experience, with a strong commitment to research and education in cybersecurity. Research experience in operational technology (OT) systems and practical work experience outside of academia is required. National Laboratory, Department of Energy, or Department of Defense-related experience a plus.
Preferred Requirements
  • U.S. citizenship required. Able to obtain and maintain a DOE Q clearance, SCI, and special accesses as required.
Job Information
  • Salary Grade: 260
  • Chosen applicants are required a "demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working environment.”
INL Overview

INL is a science-based, applied engineering national laboratory dedicated to supporting the U.S. Department of Energy’s mission in nuclear energy research, science, and national defense. With more than 5,000 scientists, researchers, and support staff, the laboratory works with national and international governments, universities and industry partners to discover new science and development technologies that underpin the nation’s nuclear and renewable energy, national security, and environmental missions.

INL Mission

Our mission is to discover, demonstrate and secure innovative nuclear energy solutions, other clean energy options and critical infrastructure.

INL Vision

Our vision is to change the world’s energy future and secure our nation’s critical infrastructure.
